evaluations.title: 12-Month Momentum with 1-Month Reversal
evaluations.reasoning: Classic momentum factor with strong academic foundation (Jegadeesh & Titman 1993). Sharpe 1.42 is excellent, 1-month reversal skip addresses short-term mean reversion. Core momentum exposure for portfolio.

evaluations.title: Earnings-to-Price Value Factor
evaluations.reasoning: Fundamental value factor with clear economic rationale. E/P captures expected returns premium for distressed stocks. Negative correlation with momentum provides diversification.

evaluations.title: ROE Quality with Stability Filter
evaluations.reasoning: Quality factor with stability filter reduces noise. Defensive characteristics complement value and momentum. Low drawdown (-16.8%) adds portfolio stability.

evaluations.title: Low Volatility Beta Anomaly
evaluations.reasoning: Highest Sharpe (1.55) and lowest MDD (-12.3%) in pool. Betting against beta anomaly well-documented. Provides downside protection in volatile markets - valuable hedge.

evaluations.title: Small Cap Premium Factor
evaluations.reasoning: Classic Fama-French size factor. Higher drawdown (-28.4%) but provides unique market cap exposure. Negative correlation with low-vol adds diversification.

evaluations.title: 52-Week High Proximity Momentum
evaluations.reasoning: Alternative momentum construction (George & Hwang 2004). Correlated with 12M momentum but captures anchoring bias differently. Cluster weighting handles correlation.

evaluations.title: Book-to-Market Value Factor
evaluations.reasoning: Original HML factor. Weaker recent performance but diversifies E/P signal. Different value lens captures different stocks. Cluster weighting reduces redundancy risk.

evaluations.title: Gross Profitability Factor
evaluations.reasoning: Novy-Marx (2013) quality measure. Excellent Sharpe (1.45), robust across caps, and less manipulation-prone than net profitability. Strong complement to ROE stability.

evaluations.title: Short-Term Reversal Factor
evaluations.reasoning: High turnover (850%) but strong CAGR (18.5%). Turnover reduction through position offsetting makes this viable. Unique reversal exposure uncorrelated with other factors. Flag turnover but SELECT due to combined portfolio benefits.

evaluations.title: Asset Growth Anomaly
evaluations.reasoning: Cooper et al. (2008) asset growth effect. Unique investment-related signal. Low correlation with momentum/value factors. Adds diversification to portfolio.

key_observations: All alphas have aligned rationale - hypothesis matches implementation
No critical red flags (Sharpe < 3.0, no data bugs detected)
High turnover in reversal factor offset by position diversification
Low-vol acts as natural hedge against risk-on factors
